intro: Metrosideros nitida, commonly known as the silver mist flower or silver mist tree, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree or shrub that typically grows up to 8 meters in height. The plant is characterized by its slender, often drooping branches and its clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that appear in spring. Its leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and have a silvery sheen, giving the plant its common name. Metrosideros nitida is well adapted to coastal environments and is often found in sandy soils along the shores of New Zealand.
